message.content:
cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the challenges and developments in Fog computing, which is a computing paradigm that extends Cloud-based computing, storage, and networking facilities to support the computational demand of real-time latency-sensitive applications of largely geo-distributed IoT devices/sensors. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also discusses the networking aspect of Fog computing, which makes cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) another likely category. The paper also discusses the challenges in the intermediate layer between IoT devices/sensors and Cloud datacentres, which makes cs.SY (Systems and Control) and cs.SE (Software Engineering) likely categories. Finally, the paper discusses the taxonomy of Fog computing, which makes cs.CY (Computers and Society) a possible category.
